title: For Justin Williams, Another Win. But Not Just Another Bike Race.
sub_head: The “L39ION” team owner prevails in Tulsa, just days after the 100th anniversary of the city’s horrifying racial massacre
body:
Over the years, Justin Williams has won plenty of bike races. But none of them felt quite like Friday night’s victory in Tulsa, Okla.
In the lead-up to Friday’s competition—part of the “Tulsa Tough” weekend of cycling action—Williams paid a visit the city’s Greenwood neighborhood, the site of “Black Wall Street,” a once-thriving cluster of Black-owned businesses destroyed by a white mob 100 years ago in the atrocity known as the Tulsa Race Massacre.
“It was an incredible experience,” Williams told me Saturday. “It was so emotional.”
For Williams, a 32-year-old Black cyclist and team owner from Los Angeles trying to widen Black ridership and diversify a predominantly white sport, the visit to Greenwood was a moving reminder of another era of Black business, one that was burned to the ground on May 31, 1921, in a horror which killed as many as 300 people.
“I could just feel the heaviness,” Williams said. “What it must have felt like, to have been trying to do something good for your family and your community.”
